pros: Positive work environment, great leadership, centrally located in the valley.

review_title: Dont do it- Will only hold back your career
job_title: Admissions Advisor in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Some autonomy in roles.  This is mostly because no one knows how to do their jobs and don't know how to manage.  Around holidays, more time off than most places (no one shows up...poor students who need things done)
cons: All around poor place to work.  Horrible benefits, don't pay their bills on time so collectors are constantly calling to get paid, don't follow FERPA guidelines properly and there are no annual raises or opportunity for growth.  Do yourself a favor and keep looking for other employment.  This place is not a place to be proud of.

review_title: President has a great open door approach
job_title: Admissions & Student Services Department in Chula Vista, CA
pros:
The staff are very passionate about what they do. They take care of their students. 
Great new location in MissionValley.
Your empowered and have autonomy to do take care of students. Employees that do, get recognized.
cons:
The move had a few hiccups, students and employees please  be patient. 
Small staff and they are trying. Great content and learning outcomes (I took a few classes).
They recently had a restructure, but it was needed and they even allowed us to continue our TA benefits.

pros: The school is growing at a meteoric rate and there are many areas for opportunity for those who are hard-working and care about students.
Admissions pays better than other schools
cons: I was there for a short time but i saw the red flags almost immediately.  Absolutely no leadership.  People have no idea what they are doing.  Unless you are looking for a chaotic environment and no job security, stay away.

review_title: Great undervalued staff, poor management and leadership
job_title: Student Account Representative in San Diego, CA
pros: Great colleagues whole all try their best to assist the students through all the transition
cons: No direction, lack of communication and no security of where the university is headed. Student focus and experience is cared less the higher up the company you go.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Diego, CA
cons: Poorly organized, same lazy staff, school caters mostly to foreign student to keep the school afloat or the mismanaged FNP program.

job_title: Admissions Advisor in Chula Vista, CA
pros: Freedoms but only because lack of organization
some of the co-workers was nice
cons: terrible work environment and pay was horrible.
